    Amateur Radio Links

    On this page

    • Antennas
    • Electronics
      • Calculators
      • Class D/E Amplifiers
    • Transceivers
      • QRP SDR
    • General
      • Homebrew

    Here is a collection of amateur radio links.

    Antennas

    1. Frank N4SPP’s antenna projects https://www.nonstopsystems.com/radio/antennas_home.htm#top-of-page which includes End Fed Half Wave (EFHW) antenna construction with links - https://www.nonstopsystems.com/radio/frank_radio_antenna_multiband_end-fed.htm (added 22/11/20)
    2. L.B. Cebik W4RNL (SK) documents http://on5au.be/Cebik%20documents.html

    Electronics

    Calculators

    1. Filter design, Skin depth, Smith Charts etc - https://leleivre.com/rftools.html (added 14/4/20)

    Class D/E Amplifiers

    1. Class E amplifier design and construction - http://www.classeradio.com/ (added 14/4/20)
    2. AMfone Class E forum - http://amfone.net/Amforum/index.php?board=76.0 (added 14/4/20)
    3. VK3HN’s website (links to the sites above and more) - https://vk3hn.wordpress.com/am/

    Transceivers

    QRP SDR

    1. Transform QCX into an SDR SSB transceiver https://github.com/threeme3/QCX-SSB
    2. Micro software defined transceiver (uSDX) group https://groups.io/g/ucx/topics

    General

    Homebrew

    1. Peter B Marks VK2TPM marxy’s musing on technology - http://blog.marxy.org/
    2. Owen Duffy VK2OMD - https://owenduffy.net
    3. Peter Parker VK3YE - http://vk3ye.com/
    4. Charlie Morris ZL2CTM - http://zl2ctm.blogspot.com/
    5. EDN Create radio receiver circuits with the LM386 audio amplifier - https://www.edn.com/create-radio-receiver-circuits-with-the-lm386-audio-amplifier/
    6. Doug Hunter VK4ADC https://www.vk4adc.com/web/index.php
    7. Razvan M0HZH 600W HF amplifier https://qrpblog.com/a600-hf-6m-600w-ldmos-amplifier/
    8. Rob VK4HAT https://robs-blog.net/ (includes copy of LTSpice for RADIO Aateurs and Crystal Sets to Sideband)

    Tags: linux, ubuntu

    You may also enjoy

    Debian on armhf emulation via QEMU

    This post describes how to emulate an Arm hard float (armhf) using using qemu and install Debian Linux on the emulator.

    Trailer Bearings

    Here is how you tell what types of trailer bearings you have without taking them out.

    Building the Beaglebone kernel

    This post describes how to cross compile the Beaglebone Black (BBB) or Beaglebone Green (BBG) Linux kernel on an Ubuntu 18.04 Linux machine.

    Beaglebone to Si5351 interface via i2c

    This post describes how to connect the BeagleBone to a Silicon Labs Si5351 i2c clock generator.
